actions.text: Committee on Veterans ordered to be reported an original measure in lieu of S.1788.
Committee on Veterans. Original measure reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski under the authority of the order of Nov 23, 85. With written report No. 99-200.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 438.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.

official_title: An original bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to increase the rates of disabiltiy compensation for disabled veterans and the rates of dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses and children of veterans, to improve veterans' education benefits, and to improve the Veterans' Administration home loan guaranty program; to amend titles 10 and 38, United States Code, to improve national cemetery programs; and for other purposes.
short_title: Veterans' Compensation and Benefits Improvement Act of 1985

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended) Amends Federal veterans' benefits provisions to set at July 1, 1985, the final date at which a person must have entered the armed forces in order to be eligible for special educational assistance for post-Vietnam era veterans. Repeals a specified provision of the Carl D. Perkins Vocational Education Act to conform with changes made under this Act.

titles.title: Veterans' Compensation and Benefits Improvement Act of 1985
Veterans' Compensation and Benefits Improvement Act of 1985

An original bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to increase the rates of disabiltiy compensation for disabled veterans and the rates of dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses and children of veterans, to improve veterans' education benefits, and to improve the Veterans' Administration home loan guaranty program; to amend titles 10 and 38, United States Code, to improve national cemetery programs; and for other purposes.
